alert.note: Alert for Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 4:40AM CDT until further notice by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Cameron and Willacy. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 440 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Los Fresnos, South Padre Island, Rancho Viejo, Rio Hondo, Arroyo City, Laureles, Olmito, Port Of Brownsville, Cameron Park, Southmost, Downtown Brownsville, Brownsville, San Perlita, Lincoln Park, Holly Beach, Palmer Laasko Elementary, Lozano, Library Memorial Middle School, Los Fresnos High School and Rio Hondo High School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
